00.text: When life feels heavy, remember God's joy is your strength, uplifting your spirit and infusing each day with His boundless love.

01.text: Brothers, my heart''s desire and prayer to God for them is that they may be saved.

02.text: And he said to them, The harvest is plentiful, but the laborers are few. Therefore pray earnestly to the Lord of the harvest to send out laborers into his harvest.

03.text: For though we walk in the flesh, we are not waging war according to the flesh.

04.text: For the weapons of our warfare are not of the flesh but have divine power to destroy strongholds.

05.text: We destroy arguments and every lofty opinion raised against the knowledge of God, and take every thought captive to obey Christ...

06.text: There is none like you, O Lord you are great, and your name is great in might.

07.text: The memory of the righteous is a blessing, but the name of the wicked will rot.

08.text: Heal the sick, raise the dead, cleanse lepers, cast out demons. You received without paying give without pay.

09.text: I am the door. If anyone enters by me, he will be saved and will go in and out and find pasture.

10.text: But the Lord is the true God he is the living God and the everlasting King. At his wrath the earth quakes, and the nations cannot endure his indignation.

11.text: I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.

12.text: Hatred stirs up strife, but love covers all offenses.

13.text: For everyone who calls on the name of the Lord will be saved.

14.text: I am the good shepherd. I know my own and my own know me...

15.text: And how are they to preach unless they are sent? As it is written, How beautiful are the feet of those who preach the good news!

16.text: And he took them in his arms and blessed them, laying his hands on them.

17.text: O Lord, you hear the desire of the afflicted you will strengthen their heart you will incline your ear.

18.text: He executes justice for the fatherless and the widow, and loves the sojourner, giving him food and clothing.

19.text: And he said, O man greatly loved, fear not, peace be with you be strong and of good courage. And as he spoke to me, I was strengthened and said, Let my lord speak, for you have strengthened me.

20.text: Nevertheless, do not rejoice in this, that the spirits are subject to you, but rejoice that your names are written in heaven.

21.text: A remnant will return, the remnant of Jacob, to the mighty God.

22.text: Let us draw near with a true heart in full assurance of faith, with our hearts sprinkled clean from an evil conscience and our bodies washed with pure water.

23.text: Let us hold fast the confession of our hope without wavering, for he who promised is faithful.

24.text: And let us consider how to stir up one another to love and good works...

25.text: And Joshua said to them, Do not be afraid or dismayed be strong and courageous. For thus the Lord will do to all your enemies against whom you fight.

26.text: So have no fear of them, for nothing is covered that will not be revealed, or hidden that will not be known.

27.text: Jesus looked at them and said, With man it is impossible, but not with God. For all things are possible with God.

28.text: The hope of the righteous brings joy, but the expectation of the wicked will perish.

29.text: Are not two sparrows sold for a penny? And not one of them will fall to the ground apart from your Father.

30.text: But even the hairs of your head are all numbered.

31.text: Fear not, therefore you are of more value than many sparrows.

32.text: So everyone who acknowledges me before men, I also will acknowledge before my Father who is in heaven...

33.text: But a Samaritan, as he journeyed, came to where he was, and when he saw him, he had compassion.

34.text: For you had compassion on those in prison, and you joyfully accepted the plundering of your property, since you knew that you yourselves had a better possession and an abiding one.

35.text: Therefore do not throw away your confidence, which has a great reward.

36.text: For you have need of endurance, so that when you have done the will of God you may receive what is promised.

37.text: He said, The one who showed him mercy. And Jesus said to him, You go, and do likewise.

38.text: But my righteous one shall live by faith, and if he shrinks back, my soul has no pleasure in him.

39.text: But we are not of those who shrink back and are destroyed, but of those who have faith and preserve their souls.

40.text: Whoever receives you receives me, and whoever receives me receives him who sent me.

41.text: And when the ten heard it, they began to be indignant at James and John.

42.text: And whoever gives one of these little ones even a cup of cold water because he is a disciple, truly, I say to you, he will by no means lose his reward.

43.text: To him all the prophets bear witness that everyone who believes in him receives forgiveness of sins through his name.

44.text: While Peter was still saying these things, the Holy Spirit fell on all who heard the word.

45.text: For even the Son of Man came not to be served but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.

46.text: And they came to Jericho. And as he was leaving Jericho with his disciples and a great crowd, Bartimaeus, a blind beggar, the son of Timaeus, was sitting by the roadside.

47.text: And when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to cry out and say, Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!

48.text: And many rebuked him, telling him to be silent. But he cried out all the more, Son of David, have mercy on me!

49.text: And Jesus stopped and said, Call him. And they called the blind man, saying to him, Take heart. Get up he is calling you.

50.text: In moments of uncertainty, rest in the knowledge that God's promises never fail. His faithfulness is your anchor, and His love is your steadfast hope.

51.text: In every challenge, trust that God is your refuge. His peace will guard your heart, and His love will carry you through every storm.

52.text: And Jesus said to him, Go your way your faith has made you well. And immediately he recovered his sight and followed him on the way.

53.text: When doubt whispers lies, trust in the truth of God's Word. His promises are a firm foundation, guiding you with unwavering light and unfailing love.

54.text: In the silence of waiting, trust that God's timing is perfect. His plans for you are woven with purpose, filling your path with hope and unfolding His blessings in due time.

55.text: When the road ahead seems unclear, lean on God's wisdom. His guidance will illuminate your path, and His love will light the way forward with hope and assurance.

56.text: When your heart feels heavy, remember that God's strength is made perfect in your weakness. Lean into His grace, and find courage to rise anew.

57.text: In moments of uncertainty, hold onto God's unchanging hand. His presence is your anchor, bringing comfort and strength to your soul.

58.text: In every storm, take refuge in God's unwavering peace. His shelter is a place of calm, reassuring your heart with His boundless love and steadfast protection.

59.text: In the quiet whispers of your heart, hear God's promise: He walks beside you, turning each step into a testament of His unwavering love and faithfulness.
